p.s: I think the German linguist philosopher Ludwig Wittgenstein with his statement The limits of my language are the limits of my world is right.
When one only speaks their mother tongue, one can only communicate in their native country.
This means that their native country is the limit of [their] world because they do not speak other languages.
Learning a languaglanguage is important in a globalized world.
One is more often in contact with people from other countries, hence has to learn more languages to communicate.
MoroverMoreover more employesemployers expect their employees to be multilingual.
When everyone speaks more than one language the gap between communities would not be as huge as before and one could learn a lot from other countries, their language and their culture.
